title: AI Voice Agent Retelling Project
description:
Project Summary:
I’m hiring for a complete build of an inbound AI voice receptionist system for a medical aesthetics clinic. The system must answer incoming calls, handle bookings, respond to treatment questions, capture and log lead details, and manage appointment gaps — all via automated responses. This project is for one clinic but should be structured so I can easily duplicate it for other clinics in the future.

Key Objectives:

Inbound call answering with booking functionality

SMS/email follow-ups after calls where no booking occurs

AI responses to common treatment questions

Data logging of every call and lead into a spreadsheet system

System to track cancellations and notify leads of openings via SMS or similar messaging

Upsell opportunities offered by AI after confirmed bookings

Delivery of a reusable template for use with other businesses

Detailed Breakdown of What’s Required:

1. AI Receptionist Handling Inbound Calls
The AI must pick up all calls during open hours and after hours. It should manage bookings, rescheduling, and cancellations using a connected calendar system and log each interaction into a structured spreadsheet with contact and treatment information.

2. Answering Common FAQs
The AI should handle typical client questions about treatments, such as treatment differences, duration of effects, pricing ranges, and pre-treatment care. Example: answering what the difference is between two treatment types.

3. Lead Capture for Enquiries Without Bookings
For callers who do not book, the AI must collect key details including name, contact information, and treatment interest, and store these in the spreadsheet for future follow-up.

4. Automated Follow-Up Messaging
There should be automated follow-ups for non-booked leads, sent via text or email within a defined period (such as 24 to 48 hours), logged in the spreadsheet system.

5. Handling Cancellations and Refilling Gaps
The system must track appointment cancellations and offer the available slots to recent enquiries or waitlist contacts via messaging — no outbound calling required.

6. Upselling Treatments After Booking
Following a successful booking, AI should suggest additional services that pair well with their treatment, optionally confirming these add-ons during the call or follow-up messaging.

7. Pre-Treatment Guidance
After a booking, the system should automatically send treatment preparation instructions to the client.

8. After-Hours Call Handling
Outside business hours, the AI must still answer calls, capture caller information, and offer a callback option for the next day.

Expected Deliverables:

Fully functional AI receptionist system working end-to-end

Connected automation scenarios managing call responses and data logging

Calendar booking system integration

SMS and/or email integration for follow-ups

Cancellations triggering gap-fill messages

Simple template for re-use across other businesses

Clear, user-friendly setup guide for template replication

How You’ll Be Evaluated:
I will test all main flows after setup: answering, booking, FAQ responses, data logging, follow-ups, and cancellation responses. The project will be considered successful when the system handles these tasks accurately without manual intervention.

To Apply:
Please provide your estimated time for completion, a fixed project quote, and a brief summary of how you would approach this build. If you deliver this project successfully, I will have additional projects of the same nature on an ongoing basis.

title: WordPress Speed Optimization & Siteground Caching Conflict Resolution (Everflow Integration Issue)
description:
We are looking for an experienced WordPress performance expert to significantly improve the mobile and desktop speed scores of our website:
https://naturalheartdoctor.com

Currently, our PageSpeed Insights mobile score is 35/100, with serious issues related to:

Large Contentful Paint (LCP)

Total Blocking Time (TBT)

Render-blocking JavaScript

Unoptimized images

Caching & CDN setup

Additional Requirement: Fix Siteground Caching Conflict
Our site is hosted on Siteground, and there is a conflict between Siteground's caching system (SG Optimizer) and an integrated third-party platform called Everflow (affiliate tracking platform).
Siteground's caching is currently interfering with Everflow’s tracking links and scripts.

We need someone who can:

Diagnose and fix the Siteground–Everflow conflict

Set up advanced caching and performance tuning without breaking affiliate tracking

Scope of Work:
Speed Optimization Tasks:
Implement full Core Web Vitals improvements (LCP, FID, CLS)

Set up proper CDN configuration (Cloudflare or Bunny.net)

Optimize all images (WebP/AVIF + compression + correct sizing)

Minify and defer JavaScript and CSS

Inline critical CSS & lazy load non-critical assets

Set up lazy loading for images, background images, and videos

Clean and optimize the WordPress database

Audit and remove unused plugins or scripts

Ensure mobile speed is dramatically improved

Everflow & Caching Conflict Resolution:
Investigate current Siteground caching configuration

Correct caching policies to prevent breaking Everflow tracking

Create page-level or script-level exclusions as needed (dynamic affiliate URLs, cookies, etc.)

Requirements:
Proven WordPress performance optimization experience

Siteground hosting & caching experience (familiar with SG Optimizer quirks)

Ability to work with Everflow affiliate platform or similar third-party script integrations

Cloudflare experience (or similar CDN)

Ability to work directly in Siteground + WordPress backend

Excellent communicator with proactive status updates

Deliverables:
Before/After speed reports using Google PageSpeed Insights & GTmetrix

List of changes made + plugin configurations documented

A conflict-free caching setup that allows Everflow tracking to work properly

Improved mobile score target: 80+ minimum (desktop 90+)

Bonus if you have:
Experience with Elementor, Kadence, or similar WordPress builders

Experience with Perfmatters, WP Rocket, or other speed plugins

Previous work with affiliate tracking platforms

To Apply:
Please include:

Examples of WordPress sites you’ve optimized (before/after speed results)

How you’ve resolved third-party script or tracking conflicts in the past

Your estimated time to complete this project

We are ready to hire immediately.
If you’re a pro at site speed AND understand caching conflicts, this is for you.

title: Full-Stack SaaS Development Team for Industrial Equipment Monitoring Dashboard
description:
Full-Stack SaaS Development Team for Industrial Equipment Monitoring Dashboard (Pulse 2.0)

📄 Job Description:
We are seeking a highly capable and experienced software development team or firm to build a production-ready version of Pulse 2.0 — a web-based and mobile-friendly SaaS platform that provides real-time VRU (Vapor Recovery Unit) monitoring, service coordination, and environmental emissions reporting.

You’ll be working with an oil & gas technology company (Platinum Control) that already has an MVP version deployed using Emerson/Zedi SCADA and is now looking to modernize and scale this platform for commercial differentiation.

🎯 Goals of Pulse 2.0 v1.0 (90-Day Scope):
The MVP you’re bidding on will serve as a pilot-ready version that includes:

Real-time data dashboard for VRU performance and emissions

Role-based views (Customer, Service Tech, Supervisor)

Simplified alarm and service event feed

Basic health scoring (color-coded)

Integration with SCADA data (via MQTT or Modbus)

A clear UI with responsive design

Backend architecture scoped for future predictive logic and ESG reporting

Optional: Coordination or integration with GoCanvas or ERP APIs

🧩 Key Functional Areas in Scope:
Frontend UI/UX Design

Dashboard views (single VRU, fleet view)

Uptime %, gas recovered, emissions avoided (Scope 1)

Alarm/event feed, health score badges

Simplified service ticket view per unit

Mobile-friendly UI (technicians on tablets or low-bandwidth devices)

White-label branding and styling (for Platinum Control)

Backend / Data Services

Secure API for ingesting data via MQTT or Modbus

Logic to infer uptime status from sensor values

Basic report builder (e.g., PDF/CSV) for Scope 1 emissions

Architecture ready to add predictive logic in later phases

User management + role-based permissions

Architecture

Store-and-forward logic for offline buffering (if signal drops)

Optimized for scaling to 500+ units

Must be built for API extensibility (ERP, service platform, ESG reporting)

📥 Input We Will Provide:
Example mockups of desired UI/UX

Access to data formats from current SCADA system

Alarm/event structure and sample VRU fleet data

Definitions for metrics (runtime, availability, uptime target)

Emerson/Vinson integration touchpoints (optional)

ESG reporting partners (Montrose, Sendero)

🛠️ Tech Stack Preferences (Flexible):
Frontend: React.js (preferred), Vue.js, or similar

Backend: Node.js, Python, or similar

Database: PostgreSQL, TimescaleDB, or scalable time-series DB

Hosting: AWS or Azure preferred

APIs: MQTT, REST

📆 Timeline:
Project kickoff by mid-August

Alpha demo: ~Day 45

Pilot launch: ~Day 90

Potential extension into v2.0 with predictive analytics and remote control

💬 What to Include in Your Proposal:
Estimated total cost and hourly rate (or milestone-based breakdown)

Timeline to deliver each of the scoped features

Team size and roles

Links to relevant projects (ideally industrial or field-data dashboards)

How you would handle intermittent connectivity (store-and-forward)

Experience with SCADA, MQTT, or remote telemetry systems (preferred)

🔐 Confidentiality:
All work will be under NDA. We're comparing this bid against other vendors

title: Looking for a Skilled Wordpress Website Designer/Developer — Must Have Very High Standards
description:
Elever is a full service digital marketing agency that works with high-level clients who expect nothing less than excellence. 

I’m looking for an individual (not an agency) who can support me with a big website project coming up immediately... and ideally, become a long-term collaborator on future projects.

A bit of context so you know what you’re getting into (and to help us make sure we’re a great fit):

Our clients don’t just want a “pretty” website. They want a strategic, high-performing, fast, and conversion-focused website that looks and functions beautifully across all devices.

I have a very keen eye for design and UX. I don’t allow anything to go live unless it meets a very high standard.

I’ve been burned in the past by developers who overpromised and underdelivered. So I’m extremely thorough when it comes to vetting.


About the project:

Client: A B2B manufacturing company (if you’ve worked with similar clients, big plus!)

Timeline: 75–90 days (about 8–11 weeks)

Start: ASAP (next week!)

Phases:
Discovery, planning & content strategy (1 week)
Sitemap & UX wireframe (1–2 weeks)
UI design for desktop & mobile (1–2 weeks)
Website development (4–5 weeks)
QA, launch & SEO finalization (1 week)

Please only apply if you are confident you can deliver this website within the provided time frame. 

Who I’m looking for:

Someone who is either a strong designer and developer, or an exceptional developer with a solid sense of design (I can help guide design decisions if needed).

Someone who works collaboratively and is open to feedback — you’ll work directly with me (I’ll be overseeing strategy and design) and my copywriter.

Someone who will be open to using Asana for project tracking and Slack for communication.

Someone highly responsive... I can’t stress this enough. If I ask a question or share feedback, I need to know you’ll be on it quickly.

Someone who works efficiently and can adapt fast.

Someone who is absolutely fine with having a video call (with camera on) as part of the interview process — non-negotiable.


Important note:

If you plan to copy my posting and paste it into ChatGPT, and then copy-paste your proposal back to me, please don’t. I will not even look at your website links if I see that. I can tell when a proposal is AI-generated and I won’t consider it.

What I need from you in your proposal:
 Links to live websites you’ve worked on.
For each website link:

What aspects were you involved in? (Design, development, copywriting?)

What challenges did you face on this project, and how did you overcome them?

What was the total timeframe to complete it?

Anything else you want to share about your process or why you think we’d be a great match.


If you’re someone who takes pride in your work, loves collaborating, communicates like a human, and wants to be part of something that actually cares about quality, I’d love to hear from you.

Looking forward to seeing your work and hearing your story.

title: Senior Backend Developer for ad-tech automation
description:
We are seeking a skilled and experienced senior backend developer to help expedite the building of a ad-tech automation system. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in Kotlin and the Spring framework. You will be responsible for designing and implementing robust backend solutions, ensuring high performance and scalability of the system. If you have a passion for innovative technology and a proven track record in backend development, we want to hear from you!

About RAIN Digital

RAIN is a dynamic digital advertising and marketing agency serving the financial sector across the United States. We specialize in creating and managing high-performance digital campaigns for banks and credit unions on platforms like Google and Meta. We are currently investing in our internal technology to drive efficiency and scale our operations, and we're looking for a talented developer to help us accelerate a key initiative.

Project Overview

We are building a new automation engine inside our proprietary platform, Supernova. The goal of this project is to automate the creation of advertising campaigns by ingesting data from standardized MS Excel files. This tool will validate the data, apply complex naming conventions, and then programmatically create campaigns, ad groups, and ads via the Google Ads and Meta Marketing APIs. This is a high-impact project designed to eliminate manual data entry, reduce errors, and significantly speed up our campaign launch process.

Role Summary

We are seeking an experienced and highly motivated Senior Backend Developer for a contract position to accelerate the development of this critical automation engine. You will be the driving force behind the core backend services, responsible for designing, building, and implementing the most complex parts of the system. You will work closely with our internal team to rapidly build and deploy a robust, scalable solution.

Key Responsibilities

● Design & Develop Core Services: Architect and build high-quality, testable backend services using Kotlin and the Spring Framework (Spring Boot).

● Third-Party API Integration: Take the lead on integrating with key external APIs, including:

○ Microsoft Graph API: To read data from MS Excel files stored in Sharepoint.

○ Google Ads API: To create campaigns, ad groups, and ads.

○ Meta Marketing API: To create campaigns, ad sets, and ads.

● Build Business Logic Engines: Implement the two most critical components of the system:

○ A Validation Engine to parse and verify data from input files against a set of business rules.

○ A Naming Convention Engine to programmatically construct entity names based on RAIN's specific guidelines.

● Asynchronous Processing: Work with job queuing systems (e.g., RabbitMQ, internal status-based queuing system) to handle bulk creation tasks asynchronously and reliably.

● Code Quality & Testing: Write clean, maintainable code and develop unit and integration tests to ensure the reliability and accuracy of the automation process.

● Collaboration: Work closely with our project lead and frontend developer to ensure seamless integration between the backend services and the Supernova user interface.

● Documentation: Create clear technical documentation for the services and integrations you build.

Qualifications & Experience

Must-Haves:

● 5+ years of professional experience in backend development, with a proven track record of building complex, scalable systems.

● Strong proficiency and hands-on experience with Kotlin and the Spring Framework (especially Spring Boot).

● Demonstrable experience integrating with complex, third-party RESTful APIs.

● Experience with at least one major advertising API is required (Google Ads API or Meta Marketing API).

● Solid understanding of authentication protocols, especially OAuth 2.0.

● Proficiency with relational databases (e.g., PostgreSQL, MySQL) and SQL.

● Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently to drive a project forward.

● Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively in a remote environment.

Nice-to-Haves:

● Experience with the Microsoft Graph API.

● Prior experience in the AdTech or MarTech industry.

● Hands-on experience with message queue technologies (RabbitMQ, Kafka, SQS, etc.).

● Familiarity with frontend technologies like Vue.js is a plus (for better context and collaboration).

● Experience working in a fast-paced agency or startup environment.

title: Build a Web Form Vulnerability Scanning Tool in Replit
description:
Project Overview
We are seeking an experienced web developer with expertise in web security and automation to build a tool in Replit that scans company domains for URLs containing web forms and performs vulnerability assessments on those forms. The tool should allow users to upload a list of domains, crawl them to identify form-containing URLs, and feed those URLs into a vulnerability scanner to detect issues like SQL injection, XSS, and CSRF. The project leverages open-source libraries and APIs, with a focus on simplicity, automation, and compliance with ethical/legal guidelines (e.g., scanning only with permission).
Scope of Work
The tool will be developed in Replit (a browser-based IDE) using Python and relevant libraries, with a simple interface for domain input and report output. It will consist of two main components: form discovery and vulnerability scanning, integrated into a single workflow.
Key Features

Domain Input:

Accept a list of domains (e.g., via CSV file upload or text input in Replit's interface).
Validate domains for correctness (e.g., proper format like "example.com").
Optional: Include subdomain discovery (e.g., via an API like dnsdumpster.com or a library like dns.resolver).


Form Discovery (Crawling):

Crawl each domain to find URLs containing form tags.
Use a Python-based crawler (e.g., Scrapy or BeautifulSoup with requests) to parse HTML and identify forms.
Handle JavaScript-rendered pages (e.g., using Selenium or Replit's headless browser support).
Respect robots.txt and implement rate-limiting to avoid overloading servers.
Output a list of unique form URLs.


Vulnerability Scanning:

Feed discovered form URLs into a vulnerability scanner.
Integrate with an open-source scanner (e.g., OWASP ZAP API) or a commercial scanner API (e.g., Pentest-Tools Website Vulnerability Scanner) for automated testing.
Target common web form vulnerabilities, including:
Injection attacks (SQLi, Command Injection)
Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
Cross-Site Request Forgery (CSRF)
Insecure Direct Object References (IDOR)
Insecure file uploads
Sensitive data exposure


Handle authenticated forms (optional, via user-provided credentials).


Reporting:

Generate a report summarizing:
List of domains scanned
Form URLs found
Vulnerabilities detected (with severity ratings, e.g., CVSS scores)
Remediation recommendations (e.g., "Use CSRF tokens")


Output in a user-friendly format (e.g., HTML, JSON, or Markdown) within Replit.


Replit-Specific Requirements:

Build entirely in Replit, using Python (pre-installed libraries like requests, beautifulsoup4, or installable ones like scrapy).
Ensure compatibility with Replit’s environment (e.g., no local file I/O for pygame, but web I/O is fine).
Use Replit’s web hosting for the interface (e.g., Flask for a simple frontend).
Maintain stateful execution within Replit’s REPL for iterative testing.



Deliverables

A fully functional tool hosted in a Replit project (shared via Replit’s public link).
Source code with clear comments and documentation.
A user guide (Markdown file) explaining how to:
Input domains
Run the crawler and scanner
View and interpret reports


Test cases demonstrating the tool on sample domains (e.g., public test sites like OWASP WebGoat, with permission).
Optional: Integration with a free-tier API (e.g., Pentest-Tools or OWASP ZAP) for scanning.

Technical Requirements

Primary Language: Python 3.x
Libraries/Frameworks (available or installable in Replit):
scrapy or beautifulsoup4 + requests for crawling
selenium (if JavaScript rendering is needed)
flask for a web interface
APIs for scanning (e.g., OWASP ZAP or Pentest-Tools)


Environment: Replit (browser-based, no local setup required)
Constraints:
No external file I/O beyond Replit’s capabilities.
Respect rate limits and ethical scanning practices (e.g., prompt user to confirm permission).
Handle large domains efficiently (e.g., cap crawl depth, parallelize requests).



Skills Required

Must-Have:
Proficiency in Python (web scraping, API integration)
Experience with web crawling (Scrapy, BeautifulSoup, or similar)
Knowledge of web security and common vulnerabilities (OWASP Top 10)
Familiarity with Replit or similar cloud IDEs


Nice-to-Have:
Experience with OWASP ZAP or commercial scanner APIs
Web development with Flask for UI
Understanding of JavaScript rendering for dynamic sites
Familiarity with DevSecOps and DAST/SAST principles



Timeline

Duration: 2-3 weeks
Milestones:
Week 1: Set up Replit project, build domain input and crawling module, test on sample domains.
Week 2: Integrate vulnerability scanner, implement reporting, and build basic UI.
Week 3 (if needed): Testing, bug fixes, documentation, and delivery.

description:

title: Building RAG using Azure Government
description:
Build a Legal AI RAG Prototype on Azure Government

⸻

Project overview
We need a secure, citation-aware Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) prototype that runs entirely inside an Azure Government tenant. The prototype will let attorneys chat with a corpus of federal regulations (FAR, DFARS, HIPAA, standard contract language) and receive grounded answers with inline citations. A lightweight web UI and a clean backend API are required.

⸻

Expected deliverables
	1.	Azure Government environment configured by code (Terraform or Bicep) with VNet isolation, Key Vault, Azure AI Search, and Azure OpenAI resources.
	2.	Data-prep pipeline that ingests legal PDFs, parses, chunks, embeds, and indexes them in Azure AI Search.
	3.	Backend service (FastAPI, Flask, or .NET minimal API) that performs the RAG workflow and streams responses.
	4.	Front-end MVP: a single-page React or plain HTML/JS chat interface with source links and basic 508 compliance.
	5.	DevSecOps setup: CI/CD pipeline, container scanning, SBOM, logging, and minimal RMF control mapping for a future Authority to Operate.
	6.	Handoff package: architecture diagram, runbook, recorded walkthrough, and all code in a private Git repository.

⸻

Key skills

Azure Government, Azure OpenAI, Azure AI Search, Vector Search, Terraform, Bicep, Azure DevOps, Python, LangChain, FastAPI, .NET 6, React, OAuth2, Azure AD, DevSecOps, FedRAMP, NIST RMF, Prompt Engineering, Legal NLP.

⸻

Communication
	•	Kick-off video call to confirm scope and grant access.
	•	Daily async status updates in Slack or Teams with responses within one business day.
	•	Weekly fifteen-minute demo or screen-share.
	•	Issues tracked in GitHub Projects; pull requests reviewed before merge.

⸻

Working style
	•	Iterative, test-driven development with small, reviewable commits.
	•	Security first: no public endpoints, secrets in Key Vault.
	•	Documentation produced alongside code (inline comments, markdown in /docs, short Loom clips).
	•	You can overlap at least two hours with US-Eastern time but otherwise set your own schedule.

⸻

What to include in your proposal
	•	Brief description of similar Azure Government or RAG projects you have delivered.
	•	Confirmation that you can provision resources in Gov regions or an explanation of your approach if you lack direct access.
	•	Estimated timeline and budget for the six deliverables above.
	•	A link to a code sample or demo that shows your proficiency (redact confidential details as needed).

We respond to qualified proposals within forty-eight hours and are ready to start as soon as we find the right fit.

- Fluent coder: Python first; TypeScript, Go, or Rust a plus. Clean code, tests, and Git workflow are table stakes
- Infra literacy: Docker, Kubernetes or serverless runtimes; vector stores (Pinecone, Weaviate, Qdrant, pgvector); vLLM or TensorRT-LLM or equivalent for fast inference
- System thinker: you balance latency, cost, and accuracy, and have strong opinions on prompt vs retrieval vs fine-tune trade-offs
- AI-native developer mindset: you treat models as tools in your coding toolbox, not just services you call

Nice-to-Haves
- Modal, Ray, or RunPod experience for elastic GPU workloads
- Front-end comfort (React or Nextjs) to wire up quick demos
- Data ops and fine-tune tooling: Kubeflow, BentoML, LoRA, PEFT
- Prior consulting or startup experience where you juggled ambiguity and many hats

How We Work
- 100 percent remote, async-first, lightweight meetings
- Ship iterative, testable slices—no months-long stealth builds

How to Apply
In your proposal, include exactly three sections — nothing more, nothing less:

1. 200 words or less on why you’re obsessed with AI-first engineering. Be specific about how you use AI to code, what tools you rely on daily, and what AI capabilities you wish existed.
2. A link to one LLM or RAG project you built (repo or deep technical write-up)
3. One paragraph on the most exciting 2025 tool or technique you’d use to 10x our workflow efficiency — and how

If your experience is real and your ideas are fresh, we’ll move fast. Show us what you’ve built, not just what you’ve read.

title: API Integration Developer – InvestNext to Morningstar ByAllAccounts for WealthTech Visibility
description:
Overview
Phoenix Industrial Redevelopment, LLC (PIR) is requesting proposals from qualified backend developers with specific experience integrating with Morningstar ByAllAccounts. The objective is to build a backend integration that enables visibility of PIR fund allocations in WealthTech platforms (e.g., Advyzon, Tamarac, Orion) that aggregate account data through ByAllAccounts.

This integration will support PIR’s growing relationships with Series 66 Wealth Managers and RIAs, ensuring that client allocations into PIR-managed syndications and funds (via InvestNext) are correctly reflected in the advisor's dashboard.

About PIR
Phoenix Industrial Redevelopment (PIR) is a national leader in small-bay industrial real estate. Through our Workspace Nation® portfolio and proprietary programs (FixedFunds®, 1031Funds®), we enable accredited investors to participate in the resurgence of U.S. manufacturing by investing in value-add industrial parks across the country.

We serve both direct investors and financial advisors allocating capital on behalf of clients—and this integration is a critical step in deepening our support of the latter.

Project Scope
We seek a backend specialist to:

1. Design and Implement Integration
Develop a secure backend API service or bridge that:

Connects InvestNext data (via API or flat file) with ByAllAccounts (via API or custom feed specification)

Transmits allocation and performance data for each advisor’s client investment into PIR products

Supports account mapping and data standardization per ByAllAccounts/WealthTech system requirements

2. Ensure WealthTech Visibility
Confirm that allocations appear in downstream platforms such as Advyzon, Tamarac, or Orion

Collaborate with ByAllAccounts technical team (and PIR’s internal team) to test and certify visibility

3. Ensure Security and Compliance
Implement secure authentication (OAuth or equivalent)

Encrypt all transmitted data

Ensure solution is compliant with data handling requirements relevant to investment platforms and financial advisors

4. Provide Documentation and Support
Deliver full API documentation and data mapping structure

Provide guidance to PIR on ongoing maintenance or changes required for platform updates

Optional: post-implementation support agreement

Deliverables
Functional backend integration with ByAllAccounts

Successful data flow validated in one or more WealthTech platforms

Documentation (API design, error handling, data schema, mapping rules)

Optional: SLA proposal for maintenance

Preferred Qualifications
Proven experience developing integrations with Morningstar ByAllAccounts (REQUIRED)

Experience integrating investment platforms (InvestNext, Juniper Square, or similar)

Proficient in secure RESTful API design, webhooks, data synchronization, and encryption protocols

Strong grasp of financial data aggregation, wealth management tech stack, and regulatory data considerations (SEC/FINRA, Reg D familiarity helpful)

Proposal Requirements
Interested parties must submit a proposal including the following:

Company/Individual Overview

Relevant experience

Team bios (if applicable)

Project Approach

Technical architecture overview

Integration and testing plan

Timeline and milestones

Portfolio or Case Studies

Examples of similar integrations (especially ByAllAccounts or WealthTech)

Pricing

Fixed fee or milestone-based budget proposal

Optional support/maintenance rates

References

At least one reference from a related integration project
